text:
Ambar quase translúcida, espuma branca de boa formação e bastante aderência. 
Aroma de caramelo/malte com álcool aparente, um quê de frutas bastante maduras.
Paladar de dulçor prevalecente, leve amargor lupulado.
Médio corpo e carbonatação.
Final de média persistência sempre puxando para caramelo e um leve toque amadeirado.
Bottle pours cloudy copper with off white head, aroma is of spices and cloves. Active mouthfeel with caramel biscuit notes, spice, and a sweet hay finish.
Golden color, large beige head. Crisp aromas of citrus, tropical fruits, yeast and some alcohol. Fresh taste of citrus, floral hops, bananas and slight alcohol. Solid.
A faint hint of vanilla, some spiciness, a lot of grain...the flavors seem hard to quantify. Im pretty sure I like it, though if Id known it was French and not Belgian, I wouldnt have bought it.
Klar orange farge med høyt hvitt skum. Lukter gjær og litt syrlige epler. Søtlig maltsmak. Kort bitter avslutning.

Large rocky creamy white head. Excellent lacing. Mostly lasting. Sparkling hazy average-density amber body. Aroma: heavy toasted malt, caramel, light hoppy, citrus grapefruit, honey, metal. Initial flavor: moderate sweet. Final flavor: moderate sweet light acidic bitter; average duration. Palate: light medium body, dry texture, lively carbonation and light astringent alcoholic finish. saboroso dulçor maltado, caramelado, como previsto nas BJCP; lembra também um pouco de frutas secas no final. Leve acidez (não prevista) equilibra bem o dulçor, juntamente com leves amargor lupulado e leve aquecimento alcoólico que aparecem no final. O leve toque de lúpulo puxa para o caráter herbal (também previsto). Cerveja complexa. O sabor lembra várias nuances, sempre alternando entre dulçor maltado e acidez. Caráter condimentado na segunda taça. 90 s
cuvée 2014 ouverte en octobre 2016. Une valeur sure de la brasserie St Sylvestre

75cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famfilora). U: Helder goudblond met gebroken witte schuimkraag.G: Granig, gist, alcohol en banaan. S: Moutzoetig en wat gist. Zacht bier met licht fruitige toetsen. Gaat na een tijdje wel vervelen. M: Gemiddelde carbonatie en medium body

Bought in bottle, from Carrefour Toulon. Pours Amber with a tight, lagerish head. Smells of apricot, black pepper and liquorice. No masking the booze in the taste, but continues to be a hint of spice and an underlying wheat flavour (almost cous cous). Fairly good, but not exceptional. Great value for 2.80 a large bottle

Apresenta um espuma farta e longa duração. Sua cor é de caramelo.
O aroma é doce e é Silvestre. O sabor é apresenta um dulçor presente no início com a presença de caramelo e Lima. Finaliza com um amargor suave que remete a frutas.

One of the better biere de garde ive had and deffinately better than the others ive had from Saint Sylvestre. Light in color with a small but longlasting white head. Aroma is pleasantly spicy with a strong and malty backbone. Tastewise it has yeast, fruit, spieces, some booze and once again a strong and caramel like malty backbone. Very well ballanced beer.
Flaska från SB. Klar orange med högt fluffigt vitt skum. Blommiga och örtiga toner. Citrus, bröddeg, jäst. I bakgrunden en lätt, söt äppelton. Lätt kropp. Nära doften i smaken. Snällt humlebett.
Cerveja de aspecto dourado, aroma doce e frutado, forte gosto de malte, sabor diferenciado, não se assemelha ao aroma, não sei definir, porém é saborosa

Cor de mel, límpida. Espuma abundante e persistente. Aroma adocicado de caramelo, mel e cítricos. Sabor adocicado equilibrado, levemente ácido, com notas de caramelo, mel, casca de laranja e pera. Retrogosto amargo, um pouco adstringente.
Good one. Creamy foam. Has a honey nose and taste. The flavour is a mix of malts and citric. The honey gives a balace between the two.
Gylden brun klar med fingerhøyt offwhite skum. Lukter fudge, korn og gjær. Middels fylde. Søtlig fudge i smak, noe bitterhet og alkohol ligger der.

en rimelig øl
den har god fylde
den er meget lys
har et flot skum
smagen er bitter
Ljusbrun. Poffade bara lite. Luktar lite lantligt. Smakar jordiga, lite brännt. Lite alkohol.
75 cl systembolaget. Hade lite svårt i början men ölen liksom tar sig! Jag kan tillslut rekommendera denna.
Poured from bottle, dark gold with medium head. Aroma with notes of caramel, hard bread and grass. Taste is light bitterness with some sweetness and a crisp finish.

750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Clear golden with a thick fluffy head that lingers and leaves lacing. The aroma is sweet, honey, yeast, toffee, pear. Medium body with many small bubbles that tickle your mouth, fresh and sweet mouth feel. The taste is complex with fruit and caramel flavors. Pear, candied apples, citrus, orange marmalade, caramel. Finish with some alcohol warmth. Very well-made!

bottle @ Vino Bellissimo / Lima OH --- Clear medium amber with lots of rising bubbles, generous two-finger ivory head, strips of lace. Aroma of malt and burnt caramel. Taste is full-bodied malt that moves through the swallow adding fizz and edgy toffee and hay, perhaps light dried fruit. The finish adds slight bittering, but this is mostly a malt brew. Big, some alcohol in the finish, lots of caramel, solid Biere de Garde.
Bottle with cork and metal thingy 0,75: Clear dark golden colored brew with an dry bitter taste, hints of caramel, citrus, pear and honey.

Bottle. 
Pours amber with a white head. 
Spicy and sweet brew, full mouthfeel

Bottle.
golden off white head.
caramel and mild coffee aroma.
sweet taste, bitter.
darker and more heavy.
UPDATED: JUN 19, 2015 Från år 2015. Lättsam och drickvänlig i linje med klassen. Ska jag säga något kritiskt så slår alkoholen igenom lite för mycket inledningsvis.

Bottle came with a cork and a metal type strap to hold it in?! Weird! But, poured a very large foamy, off-white head. Pale amber colour in appearance. Lot of lacing, top to finish. Light roasted malts and grains in aroma. Flavours of malts, barley, sour type fruits (lemon), pretty sweet as well. A bit bitter on the aftertaste, taste of alcohol is apparent. Pretty strong beer (10%!) but doesnt show it much. Ok stuff.

750 ml bottle, 2013 vintage sampled in 2015. More than less clear, golden body with a fine, foamy, long lasting white head. Aroma is malty with cain sugar and warming alcohol. Flavor is sweet malt, sugar, hint of caramel and honey and almost boozy but not unpleasant alcohol, quite hot. Fine body and long sweet aftertaste with sweet malt and honey by the end. Rather close to a triple this one. Not very complex really, but drinking more than just a small glass make it very pleasant. It was a good match to my chilly crab pancakes.

Bottle @ home. 2011 vintage. Pours an almost clear amber liquid. The head is white and quite fizzy, with medium to large bubbles that diminishes the head within a minute. Balanced sweet and malty aroma with caramel, toffee, roasted almonds, apricots, red apples, subtle vinous raisins, licorice, honey and biscuits.
Highly carbonated, medium body. Taste is sweet with a drier finish. Flavor is moderately malty with toffee, honey, gooseberries, wood, leather, raisins and hints of herbs. Some unclothed cardboard lingering in the aftertaste. Although overall good, I had expected more, especially the flavor doesnt live up to my expectations after smelling. The high carbonation level, i believe, masks some of the malt complexity in the flavor, it does get better if left resting for a while.
Bottle @ 2nd Tuesday tasting. Aroma is champagne yeast, some fruits and caramel. Flavour is quite sweet, some metallic notes,

Sample at the Molen monthly tasting.
thick white head. Lots of carbonation. Clear golden pour. Very nice.

9.5% bottle from Cora supermarket, Saint Malo, Brittany, France. Bright amber coloured with a very strong rich fruit, toffee and almond flavour, a powerful warming alcoholic and peppery hop flavour followed by a slight sugary, vanilla and fruity finish.
@ Nedre Mölla 9/7-14. Bottle from Systembolaget. Aroma: Fruity, yeasty. Taste: Fruity, yeasty, fresh, acidic. The finish is dry, fruity and bitter.

750ml bottle of the 2013 vintage in Toulouse. Pours a fairly murky, burnt orange with some ringing, creamy, slightly off white head. Nose has quite a bit of spice to it, clove, fruit cake, heavy raisin, a little booze, candy sugar, some banana. Flavor follows, heavy raisin and heavy candy, clove, banana, some caramelized pear. Fairly heavy finish, both boozy and a bit harsh from the carbonation.

Clear golden color with a lot of sparkling bubbles seaking the sky. Three finger high, white, foamy head that leaves lacing on the glass.

Nose: belgian ale, yeast, honey, sugar, green apples, pears, lemon and a bit of orange.

Taste: Complex taste of marzipan, citrus, lemon curd, orange, sweet caramel malt, pears and banana.

Medium body with high carbonation, almoust like Champagne. Soft texture. Feels luxury and classic! I like this!
@ Nedre Mölla. Bottle (750 ml) from Systembolaget (74:-). Fruity and yeasty with spicy and light acidic notes, citrus, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry, bitter and fruity.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy yellow/orange. Smells like a regular lager but tastes so much different. It is fresh, a bit acid and complex.

Bottle from systembolaget. The aroma is very nice, dry fruits with apricots, apples and pears being the most noticeable and a lighfulness to the aroma. It pours a darker orange with a slight haziness and a porous white head. The taste is nice, sweet and fruity. Oranges and tropical fruits in a nice mixture. A light body and easy on the palate with a slight sourness. This is, in my opinion, a solid and very enjoyable beer.

750ml 2014 years vintage rated 8% ABV, corked brown bottle with a label featuring a windmill, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy orange with a large frothy beige head, that reduced quickly leaving some lacing behind. Aroma of vinegar, apricots, pears, apples, lemon zest and barnyard. Flavours of lemon zest, wheat bread, pears, dried apricots, apples and a hint of vinegar. Taste is light-medium sweet, medium bitter and light sour. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and lively carbonation. Overall a great beer, interesting flavorful style with observable notes of Belgian yeast. I would have liked it even more with a higher ABV like the older vintages, this beer has enough body to carry it.
Hqzy golden with white head. Smell is yeast and hay and a bit funky. Low bitterness and fizzy carbonation. Taste is hay, a bit funky, fruits and a bit sour finish.

Funky, tart aroma with banana and stable elements. Clear golden white head. Malty sweet taste with lots of bread in combination with a fair bit of tartiness. Light body, lively carbonation dry. A really light and refreshing beer despite its alcohol content

A: funky, yeasty, acidic, grain.

A: golden cloudy with a large white head.

T: vinegar, raisins, slightly bitter, funky, hay.

P: high carbonation, bitter sour finish, light body.

O: nice balance between sweet, sour, bitter. Overall a nice biere de garde.

Barred (baled?) and corked 750mL bottle. Nose is sweet with lemon and vanilla, really nice yeast character through and through, with some mild bg fruit and minerals. Pours orange-golden with a dense, sudsy off-white head. Taste is very sweet and fruity, very light oak tones in the distance but otherwise its quite jammy in here, has a striking resemblance to Unibroues yeast character, though this one is fuller in the mid-body. Oily medium body, effervescent with lightly cutting tartness; not really bitter at all, only base notes as if aged hops were used; and the strong sweetness is tempered somewhat  by complex alcohols which warm slightly and are very stylish. A dusty, lightly herbal character under the fruit throughout. I would love to have this again!

Flasche (Jahrgang 2012) von einem Hofladen in Godewaersfelde, Französisch-Flandern. - Goldgelb. - Nase: Kandis, Hefe, mild-fruchtiger Hopfen. - Antrunk: sehr hefig-süß; sämig. Weiche, in Kandissüße gebettete Frucht (Birne, Aprikose, Pfirsich). Leicht fruchtig-hopfenherber Abgang. Etwas dumpf-bitterer, nicht besonders angenehmer Nachtrunk. - Dies Bier ist weder ein Saison (wofür ich es in meiner Ahnungslosigkeit zunächst gehalten habe) noch ein Tripel, sondern ein Bière de garde, hätte also wohl noch etwas liegen müssen. So früh genossen war es etwas zu süß und unharmonisch, um zu überzeugen. (Verkostung: Febr. 2013)

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget. 2012 vintage. Pours deep golden with a big frothy offwhite head that slowly dissipates while leaving some sticky trace on the glass. Smell is phenolic and fruity with marzipan, sweet white bread, biscuits, figs, hay, baked pears, orange zest and hints of alcohol and glue. Taste is sweet, bitter, phenolic and fruity with caramel, sweet white bread, marzipan, baked pears, hay, white pepper corns, glue, alcohol, sheet metal and plums. Mouthfeel is round, tiny spicy astringent, tiny boozy and medium bodied. Finish is sweet, tiny bitter and phenolic with sweet white bread, hay, marzipan, apples, pears, orange zest, alcohol, glue and soil. Too phenolic and quite hot... Made for aging perhaps. Would be interesting to try a really old bottle.
Light amber peach colour with creamy white head. Aroma of fruit, bananas, peaches, yeast. Taste is sweet and a bit hot/boozy. Nice lively bitey palate. Overall an enjoyable drink.

This bottle is a few years old now. Likely from 2010. 
Aroma is full of esters, both fruity and floral. Lots of overripe apples and pears with light tropical fruit. Some rose and other floral notes. Light caramel graininess and a hint of honey. 
Pours a very clear, amber with some copper notes. Large, moderately thick, light tan head that has average retention. Medium light lacing and small legs. 
Flavor is fairly sweet, but the malt notes are muted with caramel and honey being most prevalent; the flavor is showing the beers age. Moderate fruit notes, mostly ripe red apples and some lighter pear. Medium light floral esters, slightly phenolic. Low bitterness without any hop character. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied With medium high carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a pretty average beer without much character, though I doubt she helped what character it had. Oddly it had very little yeast for being sur lie. Muted make character with a lot of esters, thats about it.
Amber pour, thick fluffy white head. Nose is malt, yeast and spices. Bittersweet. Middle is light Belgian funk and bready grain. Finish is dry and inviting.

Big bottle, vintage 2013. Deep golden with white head. Aroma is discreet and complex; sweet malt, wheat, hay, grass, bisquit and spice. Taste is very pleasant, wheat, hay, grass, spice and smooth malt notes.

Labeled as 3 Monts with 8.3% ABV in corked 25.4oz bottle. Nice aroma of fresh fruits and yeast with golden complexion and persistent thick white head. The flavor is less interesting. Metallic qualities with malt and some alcohol.

Beer with 3 aliases, mine says 3 Monts Grand Reserve and is listed 8.3%. Tricky Flemish...Meaty tree fruit aroma and sugary yeast. Clear orange with a deep glow, still well carbonated after 8 months. Sweet game and metal taste I find on this type of beer often. Has a prickly start and a champagne like finish. Sweet overall, almost tart but not really, but also very hearty. Serious stuff, and like Jean Reno, should be the pride of France.

Bottle from Systembolaget, 2013 vintage. A very light haze, golden in color and a white head. Aroma is quite subtle with a light sweet, wheat, hay and spicy aroma. Light bitter with wheat and spice notes, the alcohol contributes with a nice smoothness and a light warming finish.

From the 750 ml. corked bottle stamped 11-20. The color is medium amber with a moderate off-white head that leaves a lot of lacing. The aroma is vibrantly malty and sweet with even a a vague pear of meaty fruit like quality. The body is full. The taste is also very sweet with a low but pleasing dry bitterness on the tail end. Reminds me of a British bitter like Newcastle.

750ml bottle, vintage 2013, 8 % abv, from Systembolaget, Luleå, via Gaute. Champagne cork that gave a good shot followed by smoke when opened. Close to clear golden body. Dense, white head blanketing the glass. Sweet fruit and malts on the nose added by vapour of alcohol. Sweet wheat, honey, and sweet, fruity caramel to the taste buds. Soft and sweet fruity ending. Notable alcohol. Rather easy to drink. Far from great, gives a bland impression (session in Tromsø, 30.07.2013).

Brassin 2012. Très pétillante, mais cette mousse à grosses bulles qui se forme disparaît rapidement. Couleur à mi-chemin entre le cuivré et l'ambré. Odeurs de sucre cuit et de pommes acidulées. En bouche, sucre d'orge, qui est vite dominé par des saveurs fruitées oscillant entre les pommes vertes (défaut ?) et les cerises au marasquin. L'alcool n'est pas très loin derrière, lui aussi. Encore une fois, pas impressionné par cette brasserie, qui semble imiter à tâtons avec plus ou moins de chance. Pas mauvaise pour autant, mais rien qui incite à la recommander.

Bottle .75, 2013. Golden, clear when poured carefully. Pale malts, yeasty tones, hay. Very malty. Body is full, smooth, some oilyness. Spiced malts, a bit of alcohol. Meadowy flowers, grass. Goes down pretty easy, I guess that means its ok/good.

750ml bottle, shared by Jay. Labeled "Amber Ale Sur Lie", 8.3% ABV. Code on back is "17 20". Mostly clear orange amber color. Many fine particles in the body make it appear slightly hazy. Thin white head. Only a couple loose bits of lace. Medium to bigger body. Softer carbonation. More dry finish. Kind of a nice belgian type yeast profile, more so than in the Gavroche biere de garde I just sampled before this. Light spice, some bready malt. Lightly spicy taste, light bitter. Alcohol is a tiny bit noticeable in the finish, a little heat here... I didnt notice any at all in the Gavroche. Another solid biere de garde, though.

Klar, guld färgad med jätte stort och lätt färgat skum. Doft: Fresh belgisk jäst, färskt trä, källare, mineraler, gräs, äpplen. Smak: Honung, persika, banan, röda äpplen, päron, håriga lätt övermogna krusbär, apelsin godis. Belgiska dofter och smaker i övrigt.
light white head that disappears quickly. dark yellow clear colour. sweet smell, esters and solvent, pear. sweet taste, malty, pear and solvent.  bottle 75 cl / notes from backlog
Clear amber with a white lacing head. The aroma is sweet and fruity. The flavor is also sweet and fruity but nicely balanced with peppery hops. The finish is crisp.
750ml Bottle - Golden with a small head. Yeast, lemon, banana and spice in the aroma. Sultanas, peach, banana, yeast and spice all feature in the taste. Not bad.
En trevlig välbalanserad Biére De garde. Sticker inte ut men är i mitt tycke lagom söt, lagom besk med en trevlig eftersmak. Smörkola och frukt.

750 ml. corked and uniquely clamped bottle- Pours slightly hazy golden with a one finger head that reduces, nice lace. Aroma is malt, dirty malt, very European aroma. The taste is better than the aroma, yeasty, but very European again, kind of basic. This is their grande reserve? Not horrible, but basic.

Tasted in February 2012.
Aroma: Strong banana accents. Thats it
Appearance: Gold amber, very clear, average rocky head, average lasting.
Taste: Attack is warm and round, leaving a strong acidity like a lambic or a Gueuse. Very unpleasant cardboard aftertaste. Might be a bad bottle. But still Im not a great fan of that type of beer.

La dégustation de la «3 Monts Grande Réserve» à 10% qui est meilleure avant le 18 octobre 2013 est offerte par  Ben.  Une robe ambrée/orangée qui bouge devant nos yeux.  Une tête mousseuse qui monte bien mais qui ne saccroche pas.  Un nez essentiellement malté, fruité et alcoolisé.  Des céréales sucrées qui ne tombent pas dans la démesure du caramel et dans lexcès du miel.  Des parfums mélangés de petites baies et des fruits du verger.  Des notes plutôt poivrées qui proviennent de lalcool.  Sur les papilles,  un travail considérable des céréales.  Une présence florale et épicée.  Ce mouvement est-il attribuable aux houblons et/ou à lalcool?  Un corps bien rond avec un pétillement modéré et une texture légèrement huileuse.  Une finale maltée et amèrement modelé par lalcool et la levure//Une bouteille qui porte le nom de «Bière Nouvelle 2012» qui tire 8%.  Meilleure avant le 19 avril 2015.  Une robe dorée foncée avec un col mousseux plus ou moins tenace.  Des parfums dagrumes et de pêches qui sengouffrent dans des malts capiteux.  Un caractère campagnard ressenti mais indescriptible.  Des saveurs fruitées et maltées sur un fond de houblons et de levure.  Un alcool bien intégré et pratiquement docile.  Une bouche de bonne dimension qui me semble bien aérée.  Une texture passablement huileuse.  Une finale en équilibre et plutôt accommodante sur les malts, les houblons et la levure.  Vraisemblablement,  «3 Monts Grande Réserve» et «Bière Nouvelle» portent quelques signes distinctifs.  Est-ce véritablement le même produit?

Bottle. Pours clear orange with a lasting and some lacing big frothy white head. Aroma is caramel, citrus, bread, hay, toffee,ripe fruit, apple, spices,flowers, pepper. Taste is medium+ sweet and bitter with little a sour note. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is lively. Finishes dry.

Bottle from Bruisin Ales in Asheville. Pours clear light amber with a huge white head. Nose of red apple, white peach, almond paste, shortbread. Taste adds toffee and caramel, hops, and a touch of booze. Prickly palate at first but also rich and chewy.
clear amber color with a thick off white head. Extremely high carbonation and a lively mouthfeel. The nose shows white grape and apples. Pears and brioche on the palate

750 ml bottle into tulip glass, 11 20 printed on the back label (best before date?).  Pours lightly cloudy golden orange color with a nice 3 finger fluffy white head with fantastic retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers.  Nice foamy lacing clings around the glass.  Aromas of big pear, grape, citrus zest, pepper, clove, herbal, floral, earth, grass, hay, light funk, bread, and yeast spiciness.  Damn nice aromas with good balance, strength, and complexity.  Taste of pear, apple, citrus zest, pepper, clove, herbal, floral, grass, hay, earth, bread, light funk, light honey, and yeast spiciness. Lingering notes of light fruits, pepper, clove, hay, grass, herbal, floral, earth and yeast spices on the finish for a good bit.  Fantastic flavor balance and complexity; nice spicy/malt flavor balance; zero cloying flavors on the finish.  Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a lightly slick and very crisp mouthfeel that is nice.  Alcohol is extremely well hidden with zero warming noticed after the finish.  Overall this is a fantastic Biere De Garde!  Great flavor balance and complexity; very smooth to sip on for 8.3%.  This is extremely crisp and delicious stuff.

Aroma: Smelling sweet fruity, ripe apples, pears, earthy aromas, stable.Appearance: The beer is clear orange with medium bubbles, a high nearly white meringue-like head that settles slowly leaving loads of lacing. Some curtains.Taste: The taste is complex, initially sweet, caramelized sugar, dried fruits, orange zest, ripe cheese.Palate: Medium high carbonation, foamy bubbles, medium body soft texture and  a smooth dry finish.Overall: The 2011 version. Much better than 2010, well balanced, complex and really rewarding.Note: Bottle 750 ml. (Vintage 2011) Reviewed 2011-06-25.

10%. Very similar to a Golden Belgian Strong, with less esters and more roastiness. Similarly to a barleywine it took me a few sips to really get used to this, the alcohol overpowers at first. Golden blonde colour, fluffy head even many hours after I opened it (drank it slowly throughout the day), very high carbonation. Some spicy wood in there. Yerp.

Härligt syrlig doft. inslag av källare och övermogna äpplen. Drar aning åt spontanjäst.
Mycket kolsyra som skapar ett stort ljust skum. Färgen är särdeles trist brunaktig.
Smaken har renodlade malt- och fruktsmaker. Dock stör en oblanserad sötma intrycket. Det hela blir brygd där smakerna inte gifter sig på ett bra sätt.
Eftersmaken har en träig beska och en lätt örtig, pepprig ton, allt inslaget i kartong.
Kroppen är tämligen tunn dock utan att vara vattnig.

Cuvée 2012
Ambrée et limpide, une énorme mousse persistante tient mordicus à être là, alors quelle dessine une dentelle écumeuse. Des arômes maltées et légèrement houblonnées semblent être lessentiel de la palette olfactive. Par moment, des effluves sucrées et fruitées, par le raisins vert ou encore la prune jaune, viennent me contredire. Plutôt coriace en bouche, un goût caractérisé par le caramel et les épices. Lalcool quant à lui, occupe une grande place, tout en étant empreint dune politesse appréciable, car il ne simpose pas à outrance. (Lot 108-00158 Meilleure avant 18-014-15) (370-240912)

750ml bottle poured into snifter.  Pours a nice amber with a big 3 finger-thick head.  Aroma is apples, a bit of white wine (?!?), "cherries", it gets a bit more vinous as it warms.  Alcohol definitely has some presence here.  Taste is medium-heavy sweet and becomes only slightly sour as it warms up.  Body is medium, texture is thin-slick, carbonation pretty high (that brew made me burp like crazy...!!! o_O).  Overall an interesting brew.  I find Saint-Sylvestre to be the only French brewer of interest I know.  But still, the "biere de garde" style is not one of my favorites.  This one had something special to it though, and although it would not become a regular brew for me, I wouldnt hesitate buying it again once in a while.  It was good with a blue cheese burger I had tonight.
Clear amber color with a thick off white head. Extremely high carbonation and a lively mouthfeel. The nose shows white grape and apples. Pears and brioche on the palate. Medium finish.

750 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a clear golden amber with large slightly off-white head and steady stream of bubbles.  Aroma is quite fruity, grains and light spiciness.  Flavour is apple, pear, light lemon zest, grains, and a gentle spiciness.  Fine, active carbonation.  Nice.

Bottle shared by Thorpe429. Thanks Mike!

The beer is transparent and yellow hued, with 1/2" or so of white head and some decent lacing. The aroma brings grain, wet cardboard, apples, alcohol. In general, it just seems a bit off. The taste brings some odd funk, apples soaked in booze, and grain. Mouthfeel is decent, assuming you can get past the odd flavors and imbalanced nature of this unusual beer. Overall, not a repeat for me.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 07-15-2011
Bottle at Belgian Beer Fest Boston. Cloudy yellow color, large white head. Aroma of peppery straw. Taste is citrus and hay.

Labelled as Grand Reserve. Light amber peach colour with creamy white head. Aroma of fruit, bananas, peaches, yeast. Taste is sweet and a bit hot/boozy. Nice lively bitey palate. Overall an enjoyable drink.

Bouteille 750ml portant le nom "3 Monts Grande Réserve" et titrant 10%. De couleur ambrée-orange et claire. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes dabricots) aux notes épicées (coriandre, traces de muscade), de grains de malt pâle légèrement sucrés, léger de pain et de houblon herbeux ainsi que des notes de miel. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen ainsi quune texture aux notes crémeuses et aux faibles traces sirupeuses. Moyen goût de levures fruitées (agrumes, faibles notes dabricots et traces de poires) aux nots épicées (notes de muscades, traces de poivre et de coriandre) accompagné dun léger goût de grains de malt lors de lentrée en bouche auquel se rajoute rapidement un moyen goût de pain avec des notes de miel et quelques traces de biscuits. Parallèlement, lon retrouve un léger goût dalcool réchauffant jusquen fin de gorgée et auquel sy rajoute progressivement une légère amertume de houblon herbeux aux petites notes florales. Post-goût moyen et aux petites notes asséchantes, légert-moyen amer dalcool, léger de houblon herbeux et avec un léger goût fruité (zeste dagrumes).

2011 vintage. Bottle 750 ml. Bought at grocery store. Served in Tulip. Pours clear amber with very thick frothy white head, long lasting. Aroma: fruits, malt, yeast. Taste is very fruity and malty. Lacks of balance as it is a little too much on sweetness. Medium to full bodied. Some warming alcohol, as we expect from a 10 % abv. Overall, a good strong beer, a bit heavy but still enjoyable.
Bottle. Amber colour with a large head. Fruity herb aroma. Malty flavour with some spiciness.

Vintage 2011. Bottle from Systembolaget. Clear orangeish beer with white head. Sweet / dry fruity aroma. Fruity / malty taste has apricots and licourice among many other. This winter seasonal beer is very enjoyable during summer also. ;)

Appearance: lovely straw and sunshine under a voluptuous white head. Slow stream of bubbles keep the head rocking and rumbling. Lacey collar, lingering thin head. Swirls bready and thick.

Nose: sun-kissed and rustic husked grains. Lemon pith. Freshly sliced white breads. Barn dust, bales of hay, burlap sacks. Whispers of funk. Pollen in the breeze. Soft brushed golden leather.

Palate: light, funky, barny, and lemony. Honeyed freshly sliced breads. Honey and lemon, fields of flowers, baled hay in the background, and a slow bitter pithy finish. Of the barn  dust, straw, hay, leather, burlap sacks. Love the overall rusticity and harvest quality of this beer  screams Belgium and golden fields of grain ripe for harvest while random flowers sway gently in a mild spring breeze. Dry grass joins the lemon pith finish. White pepper in the breath.

Final Thoughts: I went into this beer expecting far less than what I got which was uber harvested awesomeness. Lovely. I felt like I had traveled back in time as I savored every last sip. Harvest-tastic.

750 ml bottle.Pours a copper-pale orange clear amber with a very thick, very persistent white head. Smells herbal and fruity. Tastes like fruit, raisin, pear, bread, fruity cake, sweet caramel. Very complex, yet quite sweet beer. Strong alcohol finish, with a bit of bitterness. Warming. Body is medium. Excellent amber ale.

The aroma is yeasty and fruity and somewhat between sweet and dry. There are defiantly hops in here. The appearance is golden with a copper hue. The taste is like the aroma. The palate is smooth. Overall a nice beer, pretty straight forward but good.

Love the carbonated aspect of the beer, its a has a nice mildly sweet malty flavor slightly nutty, hardly any hops. when I drink this beer all I can thing about is having a nice Belgian cheese. this is a winner!
Golden colour with a white head. Malty and fruity aroma. Very malty and a bit sweet. Some fruity and citric notes. And some alcohol.[Bottle (2011 version) from Systembolaget in Strömstad, Sweden]
220512: Hazy golden/orange color with good head. Sweet fruity aroma. Flavor is again very fruity and sweet with a little to much alcohol.

(Bottle, 2009 vintage) Golden colour with foamy, off-white head. Lots of sediment at the bottom of the bottle. Fruity, malty nose with apricots, orange, honey, flowers (jasmine, carnation) and a touch of yeast. Fruity, malty taste with notes of bread, honey, orange, apricots and a gentle spicy/floral bitterness in the finish. Medium body, mainly dry, but with some sweetness coming through towards the end. Well balanced and tasty. Excellent example of the style. Very nice.

Bottle, bought @ Skjold Burne, Aarhus.
2011 edition. Pours clear darkish golden with a big, frothy, white head. Good lacings. Aroma has sweet malts, apricot, caramel, wine gums, pear. Mild pineapple. Highish carbonation, creamy and full. Flavour is lovely malty with a tartish twang to it. Doughy, light biscuity, citrus, some hay and grass. Lingering mild bitter and creamy finish. Nice.

Bottle. Vintage 2011. Frothy white fair mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Moderate bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. More like barleywine than blonde. Creamy palate.

2011 Bottle at 10%. Pours an orange-red with a foamy heady. Great lacing. Up front is grassy with a small hint of background apricots. Back is sweet. Foamy in the mouth due to solid carbonation. Lovely beer. Alcohol is very well hidden.

Golden, copper, clear body. Very rocky head. Big on carbonation, orange peel, clove, barn. Decent. Medium sweetness taste, orange juice sweetness. Some fresh yeast character. Bit disappointing, but a good drink. (75cl bottle, reasonably priced)
Bottle, amber pour, flavours are quite nice, its got a full body and a nice finish, just a good tasting beer,

2011 botte, 10%.
Golden with small rising bubbles, off white head leaving lacing.
Aroma: coriander, orange zest, some bubble bum, vinous hints.
Taste: fruity, spices, honey, hay, malty, orange, hints of vanilla, alcohol is well hidden.
Full-bodied, moussy.

3 Monts Grande Reserve 10% ABV. Frothy head. clear amber colour. Fruity aromas, and flavouring hops, sweet corn and some candied note. medium bodied brew with hints of toffee, sweet malts and a lush or lees aged flavour. lots of carbonation in this brew. Decent brew.
Pours a clear amber colour with lots of bubbles and a frothy head. aroma is hay and light citrus. Flavour is smooth light fruitiness bitterness no alc.

*(Grande réserve 10%): Miel fruité épuisé en arôme avec une touche de pomme. En bouche cest une corpulence moyenne qui transporte les esters de levure assez discrète. Lalcool est superbement camouflé mais cest trop inoffensif  à mon goût.
Copper colour with a frothy white head and lace. Lively to medium carbonation. Fruity, spice malt flavour. sharp tangy finish with toffee notes in the finish.
Bottle at DSG 2011. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is apple, spices, hop, fruit. Flavour is sweet, malt, sugar, apple, spices, hop, fruit. OK/Nice beer.

750mL bottle, pours a clear golden / copper with a small white head. Aroma of corn, wheat, other artificial sweet flavours and hay. Flavour is sort of a mix between corn syrup and a yeasty wheat beer, starting with the former and finishing with the latter. The aftertaste is quite nice, but the initial adjunct-like flavours arent pleasing at all. Decent at best.
(Bottle 08/11-2011) [2011 edition] Fast fading low white head, clear amber color, Belgium yeast aroma, spicy taste. BB date 01.02.14.

Édition 2010 : bière cristalline couleur dambre léger coiffée dun ample col blanc laissant une large dentelle au verre.  Des arômes remplis desters fruités, dalcool avec une trace de muscade.  Peu amère avec un peu de sucre résiduel.  Bière généreuse, à la texture lisse et à leffervescence douce.  Elle se termine assez rapidement sur un filet dalcool et des arômes légers.

Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, Ulfborg 2011. Vintage 2011 Bottle, Pours a lovely golden/amber color with a thin white head.Malty and fruity aroma. Flavour of sweet malt, caramel, lots of fruit, flowers, a bit alcoholic finish. Not bad but could easily be more complex and balanced.

750 ml bottle from local IGA grocery. A: spicy, some pear, alcohol note. App: clear light copper with nice white head. Excellent lacing T/P: body is medium-full it has a sweet short fnish. Carbonation is on the high side. O: Pleasant easy to drink could please the macro drinker and balanced enough to please the beer geek.
Bouteille 750 ml. 10% Étiquette rouge, 3 Monts Grande-Réserve. Couleur ambrée, mousse blanche. Arôme dalcool, malt, fruits rouges. Goût dalcool, épices, malt, poires. Très bonne.

750ml red label Grande Reserve @ 10% abv. Clear amber pour with a slightly off-white head that lasts forever. Yeasty biscuit, candi sugar, spice and vanilla on the nose. A little sweet and sticky on the palate with vanilla and spice dominating. Finishes with a nice spicy kick.
8% alcohol. The scent is a bit metallic, sweet and floral with some yeast notes. The taste is pretty flat and boring with a lot of bitterness and flavoring of yeast and alcohol.

75cl bottle, bought in grocery in Cassel, France. Unfiltered yellow coloured with unstable white head. Smell: some alcohol. taste: yeasty, malty, much alcohol, some industrial taste. Not bad for a french beer, but some overrated ale.
Flaske: Årgang 2011. Rød orange let diset øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er gæret med en smule alkohol og frugt. Smagen er frugtet med en smule alkohol igen. Rigtig elegant og god øl.

Bottle. Golden, hazy, small to average and mostly diminishing head. Moderate, malty - faint wheat and sweetish aroma, some fruitiness and caramel, some alcohol and faint spiciness. Body is medium, malty - some wheat  and sweetish flavor, some caramel and fruitines, some alcohol and faint spiciness. Finish is average, malty - some wheat and sweetish, some fruitiness and caramel, alcohol and faint spiciness. Sweetish strong ale - too much alcohol considering the body.

Bottle 750ml. @ The Danish Summer Gathering, TFODRBSG11.Clear medium amber yellow colour with a average, frothy and open, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, fruity, moderate yeasty, ripped fruity, alcohol. Flavour is moderate to light light heavy sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration, alcohol, yeat sweet. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft - fizzy, finish feel is light to moderate alcoholic. [20110820]
Golden colour with a medium-sized white head. Aroma is malts, grass, earth and some slight sweetness. Taste is caramel malts, grass and some herbs. Heavy palate.

bottle from kihoskh.  2011 red stamp. Corked and cork held in place by a large metal clip. Very unusual, looks very rudimentary.
When openng the bottle some beer gushed out, leaving approx 60cl of the 75cl originally in the bottle. The gushing died out quickly.
Clear golden, smooth small offwhite head.
Flowery and fruity aroma, citrussy hint - aroma reminds me of a belgian blonde.
Flavor is yellow fruity, yeasty, faint citrussy or sour tinge, otherwhise dry, but sweet yellow fruity. reminds me of a messy belgian blonde, but in fact an okay belgian style beer. Better than the many boring biere de garde ive had from france. Alc. well used, flavor well adjusted to the strength.

Bottle at a tasting. Thanks Oren. As "3 Monts Grande Réserve". 8.3%. Pours yellow to orange hazy with a nice yellowish head, aroma of fruit, flowers, banana,marmalade and a bit of sugar ca, flavor of herbs, yeast some fruits and alchol relatively dry, medium bodied.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2012 clear golden orange tint, nice white head, good retention and lacing. fruity, grassy, soapy, hint of caramel malts, toastiness, biscuity, light to med hopping - citrusy. light yeastiness. short to medium long finish - peppery and citrusy. lively.

Jag blir lätt konfunderad av denna öl. Jag mindes den som ganska en ganska lätt blonde/ bier du garde och på Ratebeer anges alkoholhalten till 8%. Den här flaskan är på 10% och liknar snarare en trippel. Som sådan är den dock riktigt fin. Relativt torr, fruktig, bra kraft i de 10 utan att kännas spritig. En trevlig dryck att ha på midsommarbordet igår. Inget fynd men ett mycket gott öl.
Golden with a small white head. Aroma of malt and caramel with some perfumed herbal notes. Sweetish malty flavour with herbs, an earthy note and a touch of alcohol

Botella. Malty fruity toasty aramel pleasant aroma. Good mouthfeel. Fruity malty bitter alco spicey like flavour. Pleasant.

Bottle, 75cl corked. A clear one, golden in color and with a dense, off-white head of moderate size. Matly, lightly caramel-ish on the nose. Some hoppy fruityness and a faint note of yeast. Bottle 750ml vintage 2011 @ TFODRBSG11, Ulfborg
Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, wheat and banana. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle @ Danish Summer Gathering, Ulfborg 2011. Pours cloudy golden with a fluffy white head. Yeast and fruit. Lively carbonation. A bit of metal, fruit and vegetables.

Bottle at a tasting. Thanks Oren. As "3 Monts Grande Réserve". 8.3%. Slightly hazy deep golden to amber color with a big white head. Aroma of fruity esters, some malt, honey hints, a bit of alcohol and some spicy hops notes. Sweetish flavor with a bit of caramel, fruits, a bit of alcohol and a drier finish. Medium-bodied.

UPDATED: APR 30, 2017 Bottle from Systembolaget - 2017 edition: deep golden with a nice white fluffy head, perhaps a tad darker than 2016, more like 2015. As with last year, the aroma is very discrete. The taste is similar to 2016, with woody peppery hops playing above the malt, leaving a long quirky aftertaste, but the hops are definitely less dominant in 2017. Not bad. The beer is back to 8% ABV again which increases the overall impression when the beer has such a hoppy profile. I have reviewed this beer since 2010 and this year is more balanced than last years hop bomb and I rate it as one of the better years. Very far from 2014s sour ale and the terrible 2011 failure of 10% abc. Good job, Bière Nouvelle.

Big thanks to SFLpunk for sending this bottle my way. Served in a Captain Lawrence tulip. At the time of consumption, the #3 Biere de Garde. Reviewed from my tasting sheet.

Pours a clear golden color with an average, fizzy white head and some spotty lacing. Thin cap throughout. The nose is light and smells mostly like pilsener malt. Light cardboard and bread. Very grainy. The flavor is quite grainy as well. Light body and no contribution from yeast or hops. Fizzy carbonation and a dry finish. Not my cup of tea.

Serving type: bottle
Clear amber of color with an off white head. An aroma of caramel, hops, metallic and toffee. A flavor of sweets, caramel, weak hops, weak bitterness, to much alcohol domination.

Thanks to Alex... Dark clear gold with an off white head... Smells like a biere de garÐe, honey, apicots, champagne, some yeast, a touch to sweet but good... The taste is very malty on the front but the finish is a touch alcoholic, so so
Bottle. Tastes like a slightly darker and less drinkable Leffe Blond. Sweet, yeasty, fruity, spicy. Nothing exciting here.

Pours beautiful deep orange copper with huge beige longlived head leaving plenty of lacing. Aroma is malty, fruity, spicy, yeasty, raisins, hops and alcohol. nose with a hint of cherry. Very nice malty sweet mouthfeel. Flavor is malty, hoppy bitter, slightly pungeant, spicy, fruity sweet, perry and grassy. Finishes with a nice warming alcohol touch and pleasant malty bitter aftertaste. Really enjoyable beer over todays BBQ dinner, great carbonation, colour ... delightful.

Aroma: yeast, grass, straw, corn, bread, hay, earthy hops, spices, banana, citrus, alcohol. 
Appearance: golden colour, medium white head. 
Flavour: yeast, alcohol, grass, straw, citrus, hay, herbs, wheat. 
Mouthfeel: incredibly carbonated. 
Total: Good beer, but nothing that excites me.

Bottle Sur Lie 2011. Amber with nice head. Aroma is hops, fruit, yeast. Taste sweet with hops, yeast, fruit. Mdium/full bodie, text smotth little thick, carb average, alcohol well hidden. Finish with sweet fruity.

Bottle from Skjold Burne. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are yeast, alcohol, fruits and malt. Not very balanced and way too one dimensional with alcohol. The bottle I had was 10% abv.

750ml bottle (2011).
Pours a light to medium amber/orange, with a faint haze, and a firm white head.
Very spicy, malty aromas, hints of barnyard funk, hay, straw, earth, dried orange peel, wax. The hop profile is spicy rather than floral, and a nice touch of yeast comes through.
Quite dry, medium bodied, mid to high bitterness, quite lively carbonation.
The taste is dominated by a spicy hop character, and erthy, yeast notes, against a firm malt backbone. The alcohol burns through a tad too strongly, but I also think this is coherent with the style.. Also notes of funk, straw, citrus peel, wax, apples.
Long, warming, dry finish. A very rustique ale, true to style, very drinkable. (2011-06-01)
Bottle from 2011 (10% abv).  Clear deep golden with big off-white head. Flavour is malt, yeast, spices, fruti, hops, little caramel and a little bitter.

A much better BdG than 3 Monts from the same brewery as it has a lot more flavour to go along with the high alcohol content. Strong taste of malt, a bit of alcoholic heaviness and faint smoky aroma but well balanced and very drinkable.

Bottle @ home. Slightly hazy red-orange appearance with a pretty big orangish white head. Sweet, yeasty, and slightly wild Belgian ale aroma. Slightly yeasty, golden, yeasty Belgian ale flavor. A bit of sourness and some yeast on the Belgian ale finish.
Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours light amber with a rich off-white head and a fruity aroma. There is a hearty biere de garde classic flavor, a little bitter and very satisfying.

Clamped 750 from Holiday in Escondido.Pours clear light copper with a foamy 4 finger white head. Med body. Lightly fruity, somewhat hoppy with a nice mild yeasty/earthy flavor. A bit more "aged" than many BdGs; a strkongly flavored BdG.

Pours very clear pale yellow with a medium head that dissipates quickly. Aroma is light, but pronounced barnyard, with hints of grainy malt. Medium body with nice carbonation. Flavor is sweet, and dessert-like apple with spices, and a little hot alcohol in the finish.

Pours orange-tinged amber into a snifter. Bright white head with good retention leaves spider lacing as it recedes to coat surface. Aroma of sweet autumn leaves. Crisp with upfront apple turning to a dry, earthy bread finish.

-Drank Grande Reserve version with white and blue label 

-Highly carbonated

-Dry, well-balanced

-slight bready flavor

-Somewhat reminiscent of a sourdough pretzel

-One of my favorites (definately my favorite beer-for-keeping although I like to drink it rather than keep it.)
Aroma is yeast, wheat and some sweet vanilla and spices. Taste is alcohol, clean and wheat with yeast. Sounds horrible but its very nice and refreshing.

Funny I hadnt seen this at all in Paris, so perhaps that means its "export quality"? Ha! Has a massive head with a nice hue of gold in the body. Aroma is cedar and hazelnuts. Taste is a modest mix of yeast and hops, classic French bière de garde style but very simple. Not bad, not great. This one would be good for the cellar to see how it ages.

Bottle. Amber pour, frothy white head. Aroma is quite grassy/earthy, lots of grain as well, quite reminescent of Orval and belgian saisons. Taste is bitter and grainy, grassy hops. Palate has a nice alcohol touch, some saison dryness to it as well. A good beer.

750ml gradually poured into a tulip glass...

Nice golden colour to the body, with some haze and a rich foamy white head. Noble hops on the nose. Some fruitiness, some herbal notes, and a bit of toffee. The taste is fairly yeasty, with a moderate hop punch, followed by a bit of sweetness, some apple fruitiness, and quite a pronounced alcohol taste. Some bitterness in the after-taste. Medium-bodied. Quite highly carbonated, and quite boozy too. Not too pleasant.

Judging from the one bottle I had the drinkability is pretty low. This beer will surely warm you up and inspire some hearty conversation, though!

75cl bottle, 3 Monts Grande Reserve, 8.3% ABV.  Large, rocky off-white head atop clear light amber body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, orange, candi sugar, straw, hay/yeast, light alcohol.  Taste is moderately sweet, orange, straw, some yeast, pepper, light alcohol.  Medium body, fairly smooth, light acidity.

Bottle, vintage 2010.

Clear golden with a medium, fluffy white head. Aroma of fruit, yeast, spices and some floral notes. The same in the taste, also some white bread. Dry and drinkable, better with age?
2010 version. Bottle high creamy white lasting head. Clear golden body. Mild and sweet fruity aroma and flavor with a low carbonation and a long sweet aftertaste.

750 ml. bottle. Label 3 Monts Grande Reserve 8.3% ABV. Pours a thick lasting white head, over a clear gold (SRM6) body.....nose is light spice (cardamon, allspice), light lemon, bit of apple.....taste is light malts to start, then spice tones, finishing with a peppery bite and a lingering hop bitterness....mouth feel is medium, carbonation high. An interesting BDG, it is called an amber but is close to blonde. The malt back bone is understated and it has the hop character of a paler BDG.  BJCP 6/3/14/4/7

750ml corked bottle labled as 3 Monts Grande Reserve, poured into a Snifter at 48°.  Color is a bright gold with a touch of amber.  Carbonation is very good producing a fluffy white head.  Aroma is skunky with a faint fruity yeast scent in back.  Medium body that goes down with a crisp mouth feel.  Flavor is a fruity yeast flavor with hints of pineapple, a touch of lemon and a mild bitterness.  After taste is a bit dry with a lingering bitterness and the alcohol showing on the very end.  Overall its a tasty Belgian brew.

750mL bottle, labeled as the 3 Monts Grande Reserve, purchased at Whole Foods in downtown DC. Pours a bright, clear, beautiful golden-orange color; significant, off-white, fine-bubbled head with solid retention and lacing; nice-looking pour on this. From the first sniff, this has all the markings of an authentic farmhouse ale: a modestly funky, cobwebby yeast character, suggesting brett amidst a wide-reaching cocktail of yeast strains; a bright citrus note at the forefront, some overripe fruits (but not overly so), hints of a caramel note; very engaging nose; reasonably well-attenuated. Medium-full body; lively carbonation; no alcohol showing with any roughness (slightly warming as it warms in the glass), and reasonably smooth; nice presentation in the mouth; lots of doughy and toasty maltiness, some honeyed malts and mild citrus, plus that nicely funky / rustic yeast character: white pepper, citrus, and a slightly tart component; nicely crisp at the core of things, and just a very authentic-seeming, mildly funky, pleasantly done Biere de Garde; one of the best Ive ever sampled; seriously, huge amounts of pepperiness that builds. Lengthy finish, with some of that alcohol warming things up: that toasty / biscuity maltiness heightens, with light citrus and a long, lasting toastiness.

Bottle of the 2010.  Great looking beer: medium light copper pour with a dense, creamy white head.  Aroma is rather rustic - it screams "farmhouse ale".  Straw-like graininess and earthy hops.  Flavor is fairly dry.  Very light astringency on the mid-palate that I would more likely attribute to the malt rather than the hops with a nice, light, dried herb (terragon and bay leaf) hop finish.

750 ml bottle shared with jsprime. his bottle. pours slightly hazed golden with a huge fluffy white head. aroma of pale malt and belgian yeast. the flavour is decently complex, rotating between pale malt and yeast. the roasted malt adds some complexity but doesnt really show. very good overall.

Bottle:  The aroma consists of yeast, honey, musty basement, and floral notes.  It pours a transparent golden-orange with a moderate white head.  The flavor starts with sweet honey and yeast.  The finish has moderate grassiness, floral notes, and spice.  Light-medium bodied with lively carbonation.

750 ml bottle, 2009, acquired by trade w/Glouglouburp. Pours gold with a 2 finger foamy white head.  Aroma is fruity with light spice and yeast.  Moderate palate with active carbonation. Flavor is a nice combo of spice/fruit/malt. Slightly sweet. Mild hop finish.

750 ml corked and caged (kinda) bottle poured a clear goldenamber with a lasting ivory head. Aromas of cookie, fruitiness, yeast, light spice and light fruittiness. Palate was light bodied and crisp. Flavors of cookie, carmel, yeast, light fruittiness and light spice with a crisp lightly fruity finish.

Hazy orange yellow pour with a thin white head.  Slightly thick and viscous.  Floral, spicy aroma.  Some pepper hiding behind yeasty funk.  A little sweet to start.  Dusty yeast flavor.  Very dry, bitter finish.  Good almost of hops.  Flowery with a bit of clove.  Slightly heavy, but overall good an crisp.

750mL bottle, courtesy of ryan.  Pours a slightly hazy golden amber.  Aroma has citrus and a lot of herbal hops - mint, honey, candy.  A bit of grass in there as well.  Flavor has yeast, fruity citrus hops, and a pleasantly sweet herbal quality.  Decent amount of carbonation, light body and somewhat bitter grapefruit peel finish.

Originally rated June 2006 - 2006 edition, with best before date written on back label, 02/01/08. Just like their 3 Monts, metal tab around cork that is hard to take off and crazy big head. A tad on the yellow side, very creamy with intense retention and superb thick lacing all around. The brew itself is golden-orange and carbonation is very active. Yeasty nose with spices, apples, alcohol and rusted water. Slight burn, but actually quite pleasant mouthfeel. Mild apples and spices again, not too strong and mixed in with other refreshing fruits. Once you can get close to the end of the bottle, you can finally shake it slowly and the "lie" clouds up the brew. Pretty good, but still prefer the Unibroues on lees beers.

Enjoyed for Fathers Day with some nicely aged goats milk gouda - a fairly simple but enjoyable BdG - aroma of honey, lightly toasted malts, some herbals notes, and a faint muskiness - clean sweetness starts things off - toasted grain character throughout - moderate spicy hops - herbal, tea-like character - a touch of melon - a bit overly herbal and bitter in the finish, but still fairly tasty.

Bottle (3 Monts). Beautiful clear pale gold with excellent white head. Soft and subtle aroma with fruity esters, delicate spice and grassy notes. Medium body and fairly light carbonation, with a slightly oily, but pleasant, mouthfeel. Complex rich but light flavour. Theres fruit (banana) and spice and an interesting contrast with the finish which displays fresh grassy hop bitterness. Overall a very good beer.

Nose is rather light, just a touch of sweet malts, some light leather notes and a decent amount of grassy hops. The flavor is right on however, perfect attenuation, lightly bitter, herbal hops, light lemon, hay, golden raisins, honey and cotton candy. Medium body is extremely well conditioned, highly carbonated, yet extremely gentle. Finish is dry and lightly bitter with a lingering earthy hop note. Extremely refreshing, insanely drinkable (I polished off the bottle in no time). I cant believe this stuff is 8%... I also cant believe I had never tried this before.

Pours a deep golden with lots of effervescent bubbles and an enormous yellowish off white head. The aroma is about with earthy and berry like fruity notes with a nice yeasty baguette like dominant breadyness, but all these pleasantries are very faint and as much as you need to get your nose in the glass to find them the head sort of gets in your way. The flavor is very dry and bitter with some cheese rind and baguette. The beer features a very good mineral character with some fruity raisin and strawberry notes. The beer is very clean & Im very surprised to see that this is 8% abv, not a note of alcohol was detected, for a beer like this that is no small feat. Delicious.

2009. Clear orange brew with a big white bubbly skull, good sticky lacing as well. The aroma is very good! Nice spice, solid yeast, stiff sharp fruit (light apple, some tropical notes), Very nice - not complicated but that is fine. The taste is equally as enjoyable as the aroma. Well spiced, some pepper, allspice, apples and tropical, dank dark yeasty qualities - reminds me of a Unibroue. Solid spice finish, medium body, no oily finish or anything bad. This is a fine beer.

Huge frothy head that shrinks a bit but doesnt go away. It forms laces on the top empty part of the glass and covers the surface efficently. The brew is light and a bit yeasty, sightly hazy and with a spritzer-vitality that feels more familar with cider. There are green apples in the flavor as well, but also lots of hops and herbal tones. The strong alcohol level is well disgusied, a little treacherous, because the bottle is big...

3 Monts Grande Reserve pours a surprisingly clear deep golden with stream after stream of moderate sized carbonation bubble rising to the surface. A standard pour brought about a hefty, three fingers worth of microbubbled bright white head. The head eventually settled at a finger and left incredible puffy drink lines on its way down the glass. This beer looks appetizing to say the least.

Although the aroma is light it has an incredible depth. A hint of freshly husked grains is the first thing to greet my nose, this combines with a pale malty sweetness thats very candy like. The yeast brings about an incredible complexity laden with peaches, green apple, chardonnay and a slight earthy mustiness. The aroma of this beer just draws me right in, making me want a drink immediately. 

The flavor follows the aroma closely. Very vinous with the mustiness coming through faintly throughout the entire drink. Mild fresh graininess mixes it up with the sweet pale maltiness. The grape character leads the way in the fruit department but the green apple and peach make solid appearances. This is a very well put together beer with a great depth of flavor. 

The mouthfeel on this beer is excellent! The carbonation makes the body light and airy all the while being refreshing. Theres a nice crispness and slight drying on the finish. 

The light, airy body makes this beer incredibly easy to put away. I could see myself drinking this until the alcohol caught up with me. An incredible drinkability when the abv is taken into consideration.

I loved 3 Monts when I had it and couldnt find 3 Monts Grande Reserve for a long time now. Luckily I came across a few bottles and its just as good as the original which is really saying something. The two beers Ive had from this brewery leave me wanting more.

6/22/08

update: "3 Monts Grande Reserve" sampled 7/10/10: bottle. Looks like my palate has changed slightly since last rating, though I still dont think this is an easy beer to understand nor appreciate. 750mL bottle as 3 Monts Grande Reserve, probably a year or 2 old.  Poured medium golden with light yeasty chunkage and a short cap of white head.
